fields.description: After upgrading to the newest version (1.8.1) the UI is very unresponsive and I have found that in particular staging files does not always update the UI properly.
fields.summary: Source Tree 1.8.1 UI is unresponsive on Windows 8.1

fields.description: If I double-click on a file in any commit in order to open it in the editor, SourceTree crashes immediately.  I've attached the sourcetree.log file
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes every time I try to double-click a file modified in a commit

fields.description:
When i will commited files, Source Tree shows an error. And i can't commit deleted files...

*git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false rm -q -f -- Producao.cs
fatal: pathspec 'Producao.cs' did not match any files

Completed with errors, see above.*

before the last update, it not did.
fields.summary: Error when select files deleted

fields.description: Fail to create patch. After selecting one or more files it still gives the dialog "No files selected" "Please select at least one file".
fields.summary: Failure creating patch file

fields.description:
Stashing ignores the "keep staged changes" checkbox and always keeps them by default.

The behaviour might be temporarily corrected by toggling the checkbox on and off before stashing.
fields.summary: Stashing always keeps staged changes

fields.description:
Before the recent UI update, I was able to drag single or multiple files from the "Unstaged files" section to the "Staged files" section (and vice versa).

Now I can no longer do this.

The only way to move files between these sections is via the checkbox.

In addition, if I do a mult-select of files in "Unstaged files", and drag to "Staged files", the multi-selection is lost. (This may be a manifestation of the same underlying problem.)

(Anecdotally, I'm quite disappointed with the lack of testing that took place prior to this UI refresh. Clearly, there was a lot of fallout from this change, and it's apparent that there was insufficient testing. I'm hoping that in the future, new releases will not be as problematic.)
fields.summary: After UI update, can no longer drag file(s) from "Unstaged" to "Staged"
SourceTree crashes when trying to push changes

fields.description:
SourceTree v 1.8.1.0

When I want to create a Git Flow structure SourceTree is giving that kind of error.
Bug occured when I've upgraded to version 1.8.1.0.

sh.exe C:\Users\BATMAN\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\gitflow_local\gitflow\git-flow init -d
Completed with errors, see above.

And there are no errors above.
fields.summary: Error on creating Git Flow.

fields.description: Bookmark tabs simply disappear occasionally. Bookmarks are not persisted between sessions.
fields.summary: Bookmarks are not saved

fields.description:
I was resolving conflicts using DiffMerge. When I finished, saved the changes and close the tool. SourceTree crashed and had to close the application:


 !merge.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes after resolving conflicts with external merge tool

fields.description: When viewing the Log/History tab, the UI will suddenly switch to the File Status tab for no reason.
fields.summary: Switches to File Status tab for no reason

fields.description: I'll be viewing the log/history of a branch when randomly the view will switch from log/history to file status. Very annoying. I don't think it happenes when i'm just sitting on the screen but if I scroll through the log/history or click on other branches it'll switch over randomly.
fields.summary: When vieweing log history the screen will randomly switch to file status

fields.description:
Staging files by clicking one by one by using checkbox left to filename is very slow async operation (using git). When I'm clicking faster, it causes a lock error

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false add -f -- App.config
fatal: Unable to create 'C:/git/repo/.git/index.lock': File exists.

If no other git process is currently running, this probably means a
git process crashed in this repository earlier. Make sure no other git
process is running and remove the file manually to continue.

Can you please synchronize these threads not to fire git command simultanously?
fields.summary: Wait for lock on staging files
change do not add to stage area
Crash on push

fields.description:
Since my last update on 1.8.1 I can't select the "Launch external merge tool" option in the context menu of a conflicting file.

Might have to do with my other issue (SRCTREEWIN-4572)?
fields.summary: "Launch external merge tool" greyed out
When selecting file in either list of unstaged files or staged files and then selecting another file in another list then it is not possible to have only one selected file in both lists

fields.description: The view focus jumps from log history back to file status, really annoying when you're trying to sort out in the commit tree.
fields.summary: View focus jumps

fields.description: I was trying to add files from unstaged files to stages files by clicking on check box on the left side of file name and I got a crash.
fields.summary: Add files from unstaged files to staged files

fields.description: No more Hg Flow button in the menu nor menu entry even if the hg flow extension is enabled.
fields.summary: No Hg Flow menu visible

fields.description: In previous version was possible to select multiple files and move them to stage area by drag n drop. It's not possible anymore.
fields.summary: Drag n drop to stage files

fields.description: Instead of staging file the first option opens a terminal window
fields.summary: Staging file from context menu

fields.description:
There are two options in one context menu with the same label.
One opens terminal, second make the app crash
fields.summary: Translation fix

fields.description:
Failed while clicking on lower "Stage file" option from context menu.

fields.summary: Crash on staging file

fields.description:
After file merge application crash:
Application: SourceTree.exe
Framework Version: v4.0.30319
Description: The process was terminated due to an unhandled exception.
Exception Info: System.NullReferenceException
   at SourceTree.AppRoot+<>c__DisplayClass46_0.<UnhandledExceptionHandler>b__0()
   at System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherOperation.InvokeDelegateCore()
   at System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherOperation.InvokeImpl()

File itself is merged correctly.
fields.summary: Crash after external merge
Crash

fields.description:
There's a bug where when I've clicked on the Checkbox to select ALL unstaged files, it will just give a busy circle and will not add the files. The only way out is to close repository tab, then click on the repository to open it up again. After that, the multiple selected files will finally be stage and ready for to be commit to the git repository.

fields.summary: SourceTree hangs when trying to stage multiple files

fields.description:
On refresh of the repository after the application has focus. The tabs at the bottom do not persist like it use to in previous versions. It seems to always select "File Status". 

Expected behavior is to keep the "Log / History" tab selected prior to the refresh.
fields.summary: After a repo refresh persist the selected tab at the bottom

fields.description:
The diff view shows weird characters (instead of tabs maybe?).
Please see attached screenshot
fields.summary: Weird characters in the diff view

fields.description: When switching to a particular commit whole application hangs. Other commits are shown correctly. As the commit is on top of my branch I am unable to open SourceTree without changing branch from bash
fields.summary: Hang on diff

fields.description:
4 repositories are configured in my ST installation. For a couple of days, this brand new user experience worked. Today, as I worked for 5h with it, it suddenly crashed. At every startup, crash again, within a few interface refresh and seconds.

Something is corrupted and cached somewhere, I asked VS to debug the C# runtime error and it happened to be willing to use a too high integer value...

!devenv_2016-02-18_13-20-16.png!
fields.summary: Crash on startup
Change the text font color of the committer email

fields.description:
Since my update to 1.8.1 I'm missing the WinMerge entry in the merge tool drop-down box within the options dialog under tab "Diff". In the External Diff Tool drop-down I can select it.

Can you provide me a workaround? ..maybe using the Custom entry?
fields.summary: Can't select WinMerge as merge tool

fields.description:
After cherry-picking a commit into another branch SourceTree showed a conflict. After resolving the conflict via external tool (diffmerge) SourceTree crashed instantly on saving the file (in the external tool).
I tried it again and every time I save the file, SourceTree crashes.

Just updated to SourceTree 1.8.1. This worked with 1.7.x.

Windows Log:
Event 1000, Application Error

Name der fehlerhaften Anwendung: SourceTree.exe, Version: 1.8.1.0, Zeitstempel: 0x56c2f845
Name des fehlerhaften Moduls: unknown, Version: 0.0.0.0, Zeitstempel: 0x00000000
Ausnahmecode: 0xc0000005
Fehleroffset: 0x00007ffa6a2c4ded
ID des fehlerhaften Prozesses: 0x121c
Startzeit der fehlerhaften Anwendung: 0x01d169a350fa9586
Pfad der fehlerhaften Anwendung: C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\SourceTree.exe
Pfad des fehlerhaften Moduls: unknown
Berichtskennung: e36ad62d-d596-11e5-840b-5c260a3ba961
Vollständiger Name des fehlerhaften Pakets: 
Anwendungs-ID, die relativ zum fehlerhaften Paket ist: 


And just before:
Event 1026, .Net Runtime

Anwendung: SourceTree.exe
Frameworkversion: v4.0.30319
Beschreibung: Der Prozess wurde aufgrund einer unbehandelten Ausnahme beendet.
Ausnahmeinformationen: System.NullReferenceException
bei SourceTree.AppRoot+<>c__DisplayClass46_0.<UnhandledExceptionHandler>b__0()
bei System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherOperation.InvokeDelegateCore()
bei System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherOperation.InvokeImpl()
fields.summary: Crash when resolving conflict

fields.description: The app crashes as soon as I try to open my repository (by double clicking it in the list of repositories on the left).
fields.summary: Crash when trying to open repository

fields.description: The view now defaults to File Status View, and moves back to File Status View after actions in Source Tree. Is it possible to make this configurable, I mainly use the Log View.
fields.summary: View defaults to File Status View, please make this configurable

fields.summary: Fatal error System.NullReferenceException

fields.description: As of 1.8.1 I no longer have a Checkout button in my top bar - it would be great to have this back or better still, to have a customisable top bar (almost like MS Office apps have) where you can drag/drop the icons you want/don't want - without having to set up custom actions etc
fields.summary: Easily customisable top menu

fields.description:
There must be files in both the staged and unstaged areas.

To recreate:
1) Highlight any file in the staged area and perform an action (diff/view in explorer) from the context (RH mouse button) menu.

2) Highlight a file in the unstaged files area, RH mouse click over it, and select from the context menu.

The operation will occur on both the file in the staged and unstaged areas (view in explorer) or on the file in the staged area (external diff).

If the view is taken to a previous commit and then back to the current head (thus losing all highlighting) then a context menu  operation in the unstaged file area will operate on the file in the staged area that is no longer highlighted.

Note that "show in explorer" from the "..." menu at the right hand of a file also exhibits the same anomaly.
fields.summary: Context menu operation does not focus correctly

fields.description:
1. Press "Tag" in menu
2. Press "..." near "Specified commit"
3. SourceTree hangs
fields.summary: Specified commit in Create Tag popup hangs SourceTree

fields.description: Sometimes, when refreshing commit history (automatically, or by F5), SourceTree switches from "Log / History" tab to "File Status". It is extremely annoying.
fields.summary: Auto switching to "File Status" tab

fields.description:
Sequence of events:
# Revert one file
# Discard one file
# Commit to Mercurial
# Push

Last action of push caused application crash. 

I've been able to reproduce this several times with the same actions but crash will happen at random. Usually happens when the branch has been switched.
fields.summary: Source Tree crashing after commit

fields.description:
With the latest version 1.8.1.0, I can't stage files anymore using my keyboard. In earlier versions, this was working using the SPACE key.

The Application even crashes if I select an unstaged file, press TAB (the focus jumps to the checkbox) and press SPACE.
fields.summary: Stage selected files with SPACE-Key is not working anymore / crashing

fields.description: The new version constantly switches to commit view if one changes the branch, a file changes, etc. This is *very* annoying, it should not switch the views for me. I want to stay in the commit list view most of the time.
fields.summary: Source Tree constantly switches to Commit View

fields.description:
After updating yesterday to the latest version of Windows sourcetree, I can no longer stage deleted files. I can stage changed and new files just fine.

I get this error every time I try to stage a deleted file:

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false rm -q -f -- Upgrades.json
fatal: pathspec 'Upgrades.json' did not match any files

Completed with errors, see above.

As a workaround, I add the file from git command line and it then works to actually do the commit.

The path to my file in this case is actually "rules/Upgrades.json", and not simply "Upgrades.json" in the root folder, as the error message might suggest. Maybe you simply got the path wrong?
fields.summary: Cannot commit deleted files to git

fields.description:
On "Log/History" Screen, I select an older (not the head) commit.
In the "Pending files" window I double click one of the files that were committed.
source tree terminates instead of launching Visual Studio.

Doing a ExternalDiff with the same file works.
The same Action (double click a file) on "Uncommitted changes" node works
fields.summary: terminating crash when selecting to view a changed file

fields.description:
Whenever I try to open a project, Sourcetree immediatly craches. I cant do anything with it right now

I upgraded to 1.8,0.36401 2 days ago, yesterday Sourcetree seemed normaly, but today it doesn't do anything
fields.summary: Crash when opening project in

fields.description:
When I pull or am in the "Log/History" view focus intermittently changes to the "File Status" 
view
fields.summary: Navigation Jumps

fields.description:
Since I have upgraded to 1.8 I'm unable to deselect the split view staging view. When I click on the drop down it looks like there is a 3rd option that's cut off, but I'm unable to select it, and I'm unable to change the view, see the image below:
 !Splitview.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Split view staging can't be unchecked/unticked

fields.description:
Create a new file with any content.

Last line of the file is not visible in diff panel.
fields.summary: Given a new file the last line of the file is not showed in the diff panel
Crash when select binary asset

fields.description:
After latest update the ST switched to "modern" Win10 graphic style, but the working comfort goes rapidly down.

Is there any chance to add option to switch to original graphic skin?

Thank you 
Petr
fields.summary: Add support to switch to old graphic skin

fields.description:
This issue happened to me in 1.8.1, but after reverting back to 1.7.0.32509 it still happens. Possibly because I had updated the local Git version when I was on 1.8.1.

I get this error once every few minutes.
fields.summary: Embedded Git repeated error in git-remote-https.exe

fields.description: Error on try select files in list of modifieds (for push)
fields.summary: Error on try select files in list of modifieds (for push)

fields.description:
I recently updated to the latest version. Since then I get:
- I get ssh errors on loading SourceTree every time. (thumbnail attached)
- It has fatally failed multiple times while just switching between commits
- Launching external merge tool causes fatal failure (debug or close program)

 !image-2016-02-17-23-20-10-842.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: New SourceTree errors on opening and fatally dies various times while viewing commits

fields.description: When a file has been staged and selected you cant click view the changes for an unstaged file. It keeps displaying the changes of the selected staged file.
fields.summary: Cant see changes on files in the unstaged list when a staged file is selected

fields.description:
When running SourceTree for the first time I am asked to login. when I login to Jira and other Atlassian sites I use Google on the web so I tried this here. If I remember correctly it show a popup box in SourceTree with the Google auth url with an OK button. I pressed that and nothing happened.

I ended up having to go into my account and reset my passed, because I had forgotten it, and then login it used those details.
fields.summary: Cant login to latest version using Google authentication

fields.description:
Run sourcetree as usual. 
Exit sourcetree.
+Right-click on SourceTree shortcut to *"run as administrator."*+
_This seems to create or use new settings or environment variables_
*Notice that SourceTree now fails to find Git or Mercurial on disk*
A dialog box appears with 5 options about trying to find git, ignore, browse, or re-download embedded git. None of these options work. Browse doesn't browse. Re-downloading doesn't re-download. Only ignore works. Then git and mercurial not enabled. Preferences/Git shows the button to enable, which presents the same 5 option dialog.

I've tried exiting and running as normal (non-admin). But once this is broken, it seems to stay broken.
fields.summary: Running as administrator breaks connection to git and mercurial.

fields.description:
I have deleted (actually any changed) lines in one of my sources. I want to copy them into clipboard. After selecting lines and pressing Ctrl-C SourceTree exists with fatal error.
Error log attached.
fields.summary: Fatal when copy lines from diff window

fields.description:
I get the error below constantly.  While ticking an unstaged file, ticking a staged file, clicked the Commit button.  Very occasionally my action will work but I am spending more time in SourceTree than coding. 
---------------------------------------------------
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false commit -q -F C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\bkwc4v1z.ona
fatal: Unable to create 'G:/Coredata/Common/2016_Digital/me/ED/.git/index.lock': File exists.

If no other git process is currently running, this probably means a
git process crashed in this repository earlier. Make sure no other git

process is running and remove the file manually to continue.

Completed with errors, see above.
---------------------------------------------------

I can then try and delete the index.lock manually as suggested but I receive the message "The action can't be completed because the files is open in Git for Windows"

Also, in Help > About SourceTree my version is 1.7.0.32509 but that is strangely not an option in the Affected Version/s list.

BTW the index.lock file is constantly appearing every 30 seconds or so.
fields.summary: Constant locking

fields.description:
Getting error on start.
'ssh-agent' failed with code -1: System.Null ReferenceException. Object reference not set to an instance of an object. Old version works. Tortoise Git works. The repo is in GitLab.
fields.summary: NullReference Exception

fields.description: UI not updating when pull updates are available. Crashes on pull or push intermittently. Staging files do not move to staged box. Crashes intermittently when staging files for commit. Cannot stage file in bulk.
fields.summary: Unable to Stage files in bulk. Have to select individually. Does not move them to the staged box. Lots of crashes as well.

fields.description: When using the standalone app,merging a working copy default branch to the latest changes of the default branch pushed by others only partially works. When attempting to then commit the merge, both the Log/History view and the File Status view display that there are no files to commit. Also while merging, message is received: 'Hg status' failed with code 255.
fields.summary: Possible Bug When Merging Working Copy to Latest Branch Commit

fields.description: I need this fixed ASAP.
fields.summary: Crashes when pushing files all the time
error to open repository

fields.description: ブランチを作成(feature/br)し、ファイルを修正、コミットを行い、developブランチをチェックアウトしfeature/brをdevelopブランチにマージした後に、developブランチをプッシュしようとしたら必ずクラッシュする。
fields.summary: プッシュしたらクラッシュ

fields.description: The Installed Programs list for Windows (10 Pro) shows the current 1.8.1 version of SourceTree and a prior 1.7.0.32509 version.
fields.summary: 1.8.1 installer leaves artifacts from prior version

fields.description:
UI is completely distorted.
The refresh on file changes not working properly. 
Multi select for discard or stage lines not working. 
Would be good to have an option to show console output or not for staging and discarding.
fields.summary: UI completely distorted after latest update to V 1.8.1.0

fields.description: I have used this view many times in SourceTree - helpful for committing a bunch of changes in a component (ie, all files in a particular subdir) at once. It seems to not be there in 1.8.1??
fields.summary: Missing tree view in staged/unstaged changes list

fields.description:
I attempted to resolve a merge conflict.  Once I had, I was left with a "x.txt.orig" file in unstaged changes list, and "x.txt" in staged changes list.  ("x.txt" being the one with the resolved merge changes in it.) 

So I wanted to delete the .orig file as I've done many times before. Now, however, I right-click x.txt.orig and select "Remove," and SourceTree says basically "OK, we will remove x.txt.orig AND x.txt".  Looks to me like it is applying the selected command (Remove) to items in BOTH the staged and unstaged files list.

And there is no way that I can see to "unselect" files in either list, so that I could just have the one file I need.  

The menu item needs to apply to ONLY the list (staged or unstaged) from which it was invoked.
fields.summary: Can't "remove" a file just out of staged or unstaged changes list

fields.description:
Clicking on modified files in "unstaged files pane" does not work.
I used to see the code changes in the right pane. At this moment it only shows the changes of staged files. Basically I cannot see the code changes, have to use the 'old' SourceTree version.
fields.summary: Cannot see changes for unstaged files

fields.description: In 'File Status' view, the diff pane on the right can get rather wide, if at least one wide line is displayed. This moves the 'Stage hunk' etc. buttons off screen. The changes relevant for decision whether to stage/unstange/discard a hunk are usually on the left edge, the buttons on the right one. The consequence is that I have to constantly scroll left and right because some line further down has of yet unreviewed changes. I hope I'm not missing an option for this... it's very annoying.
fields.summary: Diff pane too wide, buttons move off screen

fields.description: When viewing a repository, I click on the "Log/History" view. Within a couple of seconds, the view reverts back to the "File Status" view without any input. This happens regardless of the refresh settings.
fields.summary: Does not stay on view screen

fields.description: The latest version is exceptionally buggy. I like the new search capability but when I searched the commits for Author and selected one of the matching commits, SourceTree spun its wheels trying to load the committed files. Finally, I killed it and after that it wouldn't come up. My main concern is to get the tool back up and running.
fields.summary: SourceTree crash

fields.description: When trying to push some changes the UI crashed, see auto-generated report.
fields.summary: Crash when trying to push changes to HG repo

fields.description:
Everytime I open the new sourcetree the size of the file preview window is reset to 50%.
Most of the time it's not possible to resize the windows untill I don't resize the window that contain the local/remote branch.

After resized that windows, the file preview window become resizable.
However size are forget everytime I close the application, then I have to resize it again and again.
fields.summary: Cannot Resize Windows / Forget latest staging windows size

fields.description: I went ahead and upgraded from my previous version, which was either 1.6.x or 1.7.x to the latest 1.8.1 and now my previously working system mercurial is no longer working and when I press the button to "Use System Mercurial" nothing happens.
fields.summary: Cannot set "Use System Mercurial"

fields.description:
I can use the previewer of the files to add to stage till I don't click on one file already in the stage. In that case the previewer stuck and I cannot anymore see the files that need to be staged. I can just switch the preview within files already in the stages.

Uncommit a random file from the stage unblock the screen and I can go on to see the previews of the file to be committed.
fields.summary: Cannot get Previews of the files to add to the commit
App crash

fields.description:
In previous version of Sourcetree, there was the option to right click on a file when viewing an entry in the commit history, and open that version of the file. The option was called Open Selected Version which would open that version of the file in a temp file; and there was another called Open Current Version which opened the most recent version in your current branch.

This is an extremely useful tool for looking at files in other branches, or previous versions of a file, and it's no longer in the right click menu. The two choices have been reduced down to a single choice of "Open" which does nothing if the file does not exist in your current branch, and opens the most recent version if the file does exist. Opening the current file is not all that interesting, since if I want to open the file though the file system I can, while opening a file on another branch can only be done by the option that has been removed.
fields.summary: Open Selected Version feature has been removed

fields.description: Stage a file partially (e. g. by staging only one hunk) and switch between the staged and unstaged version of the file - the diff is not updating (using split view staging).
fields.summary: Staged fie and non-staged file diff is not refreshing when changing between files
Crashed

fields.description:
When I try to use Git flow it shows the following, regardless of whether I use system Git or internal Git (and Show Full Output is checked):

sh.exe C:\Users\<myusername>\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\gitflow_local\gitflow\git-flow release start create-banner
Completed with errors, see above.
fields.summary: Git flow fails without error message
Latest update crash

fields.description:
When working on a repository's subrepo, the tab for this subrepo will automatically close when ST loses and regains focus. This is extremely frustrating when trying to work in the subrepo, and causes ST to become essentially un-usable.

The submodule will still be shown to exist in the repo's "Submodules" tree, but the tab will simply close. Luckily no work is lost, but it makes performing Git operations, and working on code at the same time, very cumbersome at best.

The attached ST logs don't seem to capture this behavior.
fields.summary: Subrepos automatically close when ST regains focus

fields.description:
SourceTree crashes whenever I try to stage any file

log: 
System.NullReferenceException: Der Objektverweis wurde nicht auf eine Objektinstanz festgelegt.
bei SourceTree.ViewModel.RepoTabViewModel.ToggleStaging(IFileStatusRecord fileStatusRecord) in C:\projects\bitbucket.org\atlassian\sourcetreewin-prod\SourceTree.Api.UI.Wpf\ViewModel\RepoTabViewModel.cs:Zeile 824.
...
fields.summary: Crash when staging files

fields.description:
Not sure why your "Affects Verion/s" menu does not have the version of Source Tree that Source Tree itself advertises (1.8.1.0) so I selected the closest one.

After updating I had one day of normal use. This morning, after re-launching SourceTree (closed it last night), I am unable to open my primary repository. I've manually verified that the repo directory and its associated .git folder both exist. I can open other repositories in the same D:/Repos directory, but not this one.

I am able to launch Git Bash in this repo and run Git commands such as "git status" or "git checkout ." It appears ST simply crashes.

Probably unrelated but other behavior I noticed: Since I updated to the latest version using ST's "Help > Check For Updates" I have been unable to keep subrepositories opened. If the window loses and then regains focus, my opened subrepos simply disappear, and the bookmarks are considered "invalid."
fields.summary: Latest version of ST Crashes when opening a Repo

fields.description:
Clicking on a changed file (in our case a css file) causes an immediate crash. Now when re-opening the application, since that file is the currently selected file, it immediately crashes. Our developers are all having to revert back to the previous version.

I've attached the log file.

Here's a quick summary of the issue in the log:

ERROR [2016-02-17 10:12:28,205] [1] [SourceTree.AppRoot] [HandleCrash] - Fatal error
System.ArgumentException: The number of elements in this collection must be less than or equal to '65535'.
Parameter name: glyphIndices
fields.summary: Crash when selecting changed file - The number of elements in this collection must be less than or equal to '65535'.

fields.description: When viewing the Log/History of a branch in Sourcetree, even though I was scrolling left/right and up/down to view the changes, after doing it for about 10 minutes, the screen would automatically refreshes and redirect me to the File Status screen.
fields.summary: The screen automatically refreshes after sitting for so long

fields.description:
On 1.7.* series the following was possible:

* Select a file to stage/unstage with the mouse pointer.
* Press "space bar" key for toggle the stage status.

This shortcut was very useful for to reduce the mouse movement and keep the cursor over the diff window and scroll without move from left to right again and again
fields.summary: Missing keyboard shortcut for stage/unstage files (space bar)

fields.description:
After the last update it is constantly jumping to the File Status window. Even when I am working in different views. I have turned off all background checks, but it stil jumps file status. With regular intervals. 

Yes my files in the repo are opened and closed, sometimes overwritten by background scripts, but they are not changed. So the filestatus list is always empty.
fields.summary: Constantly jumping to File Status

fields.description:
hen a file has been renamed or deeted it can not be staged. Error says: 
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false rm -q -f -- AbstractListener.java
fatal: pathspec 'AbstractListener.java' did not match any files
fields.summary: Can not stage deleted/renamed files

fields.description:
* Stage File should be Unstage File in contextual menu
* The menu entry is duplicated
 !image-2016-02-17-18-52-37-020.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: "Stage File" should be "Unstage File" when the file is staged

fields.description:
"Stage File" appears twice in the file context menu.

 !image-2016-02-17-18-50-19-443.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Double Stage file entry in file menu

fields.description: I got ssh-agent failed with code -1 when starting SourceTree for Windows (after update to version 1.8.1.0).
fields.summary: ssh-agent failed with code -1

fields.description:
Why was this version even released? It contains more bugs than features. It's unusable at this state. Writing bug reports would take longer than my actual work!
Please test your software before you ask your users to update!
Yesterday you said you would release a bug-fix version but I couldn't find one even now.
I'll revert back to an old version. Please feel free to notify me when SourceTree is stable again.
fields.summary: SourceTree unusable

fields.description:
Right now the bookmarks in the bookmark list blend together and it's not really clear where one bookmark ends and the next begins.

Some sort of separator would be helpful.
fields.summary: Add some sort of separator in between each bookmark in bookmark list

fields.description: The new app constantly hangs rendering it unusable.  Seems to happen when large files or a large number of files are updated.  Will be moving to another client.
fields.summary: SourceTree constantly "Not Responding"
Unable to delete file
